intro: Schwenckia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered schwenckia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Schwenckia micrantha is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
